page.title: 06Farming in Eglwysbach
page.content: I live on a farm which is over 300 years old and it is called Plas Llan. We have 92 acres of land, half of which is flat and the other half on steep slopes with quite a lot of woodland. We have over three hundred sheep which we keep for lambing. We buy young cows in the autumn and sell them in the spring after they have been fed on silage throughout the winter. My father has two tractors, a van and a car. During the winter months we have to feed the animals twice a day and my brother and I help my father when we can. My mother also helps on the farm.A friend helps with silage cutting. The lambing time is a very busy time for us. Long ago many important people used to stay on our farm because we live near the centre of the village. Our school is built on land which once belonged to our farm.
